elements.title: opera in Ukraine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that in the history of opera in Ukraine, Mykola Lysenko's historical Taras Bulba (title character pictured) was the first grand opera, but not performed during his lifetime because he refused a performance in Russian?

elements.title: Nate Fisher (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that before he made his Major League Baseball debut, Nate Fisher worked as a commercial lending analyst for the First National Bank of Omaha?

elements.title: two-year-old food bank (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a two-year-old food bank contributed 150 semi-trucks of supplies to relief efforts for Hurricane Katrina?

elements.title: Michelle O'Bonsawin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Michelle O'Bonsawin is the first Indigenous person appointed to the Supreme Court of Canada?

elements.title: 4th Time Around (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Bob Dylan's "4th Time Around" has been interpreted as a parody of the Beatles' song "Norwegian Wood (This Bird Has Flown)"?

elements.title: Titulus pictus (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Romans would advertise their goods with a type of inscription known as Titulus pictus?

elements.title: a Chicago TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Univision bought a Chicago TV station that wasn't for sale?

elements.title: Tobia Nicotra (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that prolific Italian forger Tobia Nicotra once toured the United States impersonating conductor Riccardo Drigo, who had died two years earlier?
